div.witness: The Pars Aestivalis of a printed Portiforium of the Use of the Benedictine Abbey of the Bessed Virgin Mary, Abingdon, Berkshire, printed at the Abbey by J. Scolar and published in 1528. Cambridge, Emmanuel College 4.2.11.
London, British Library Ms Royal 2 A.x. Fragmentary Breviary of the twelfth century from the Benedictine Abbey of St Alban, St Albans, Hertfordshire.
A printed breviary of the Use of the Benedictine Abbey of St Alban, St Albans, Hertfordshire, published in 1532. London, British Library, C.110.a.27.
The Battle Breviary. Cambridge, Trinity College Ms 0.7.31 (1359). A Breviary of the Benedictine Abbey of St Martin, Battle, Sussex dating from the late fifteenth century.

The Coldingham Breviary. London, British Library Ms Harl.4664 The thirteenth-century Breviary of the Benedictine Priory of the Blessed Virgin Mary, Coldingham, Berwickshire, a cell of Durham Benedictine Cathedral Priory.

The Chertsey Breviary. Oxford, Bodleian Library Mss lat.liturg. e6, e37, e39 and d42. The partial and dismembered remains of a finely-written and -painted Breviary of the Benedictine Abbey of St Peter, Chertsey, Surrey, dating from approximately 1320. The painting has been noted in Alexander, J.J.G., English early fourteenth-century illumination: recent acquisitions, Bodleian Library Record, volume 9, 1974, pages 72-74. The calendar is published in F.Wormald, English Benedictine Kalendars after A.D. 1100, vol. I, Henry Bradshaw Society 77, London, 1939

The Ely Breviary-Missal. Cambridge, University Library Ms Ii.4.20. A thirteenth-century Breviary-Missal of the Benedictine Abbey and Cathedral Priory of St Peter and St Etheldreda, Ely, Cambridgeshire.
Oxford, Bodleian Library Ms Barlow 41. The Pars Hiemalis of a thirteenth-century Breviary of the Benedictine Abbey of the Blessed Virgin Mary and St Egwin, Evesham, Gloucestershire.
A Breviary (thirteenth-century) of the Use of the Benedictine Abbey of the Holy Trinity, Fecamp, Normandy. Rouen, Bibliotheque municipale, MS 205(Y46).
The Gloucester Diurnal. Oxford, Bodleian Library Ms Jesus College 10. The Diurnal and Hymnal sections of a twelfth- to fifteenth-century Breviary of the Benedictine Abbey of St Peter, Gloucester.

The Hyde Breviary. Oxford, Bodleian Library Ms Rawl.liturg. e.1*. A thirteenth/fourteenth-century Breviary of the Benedictine Abbey of the Holy Trinity, the Blessed Virgin Mary and St Peter, Hyde, Hampshire (formerly the New Minster, Winchester). The manuscript has been edited in J.B.L.Tolhurst, The Monastic Breviary of Hyde Abbey, Henry Bradshaw Society 69, 70, 71, 76, 78, 80, London, 1932, 1933, 1934, 1938, 1939, 1942.
The Muchelney Breviary. London, British Library Mss Add. 43405-6. A thirteenth-century Breviary of the Abbey of St Peter and St Paul, Muchelney, Somerset.

The Peterborough Antiphoner. Cambridge, Magdalene College Ms F.4.10. An Antiphoner of the fourteenth century from the Benedictine Abbey of St Peter, St Paul and St Andrew, Peterborough, Northamptonshire.
The Winchcombe Breviary-Missal. Valenciennes, Bibl.Mun. Ms 116. A combined Breviary and Missal from the Benedictine Abbey of St Kenelm, Winchcombe, Gloucestershire, dating from around 1140.

The Worcester Antiphoner. Worcester Cathedral Library Ms F. 160. A composite manuscript of liturgical books from the Benedictine Cathedral Priory of the Blessed Virgin Mary, Worcester probably compiled in its present form in the fourteenth/fifteenth century. The oldest contents, dating from the first part of the thirteenth century, are the Office Antiphoner, Calendar, Psalter, Hymnal and Collectar. The Processional and Gradual date from slightly later. Various other sections were added in the fourteenth and fifteenth centuries. The Office Antiphoner, Processional and Hymnal sections were published in a photographic reproduction in Antiphonaire Monastique, XIIIe siecle: Codex F. 160 de la Bibliotheque de la Cathedrale de Worcester (Paleographie Musicale volume 12) Solesmes 1922, reprinted Berne 1971.
Durham, Chapter Library Ms B. III. 11. The Durham Antiphoner. Source G of R.-J. Hesbert, Corpus Antiphonalium Officii.
Bamberg, Staatliche Bibliothek cod. lit. 23. The Bamberg Antiphoner. Source B of R.-J. Hesbert, Corpus Antiphonalium Officii.
Ivrea, Chapter Library Ms 106. The Ivrea Antiphoner. Source E of R.-J. Hesbert, Corpus Antiphonalium Officii.
Monza, Chapter Library cod. c. 12.75. The Monza Antiphoner. Source M of R.-J. Hesbert, Corpus Antiphonalium Officii.
Verona, Chapter Library cod. XCVIII. The Verona Antiphoner. Source V of R.-J. Hesbert, Corpus Antiphonalium Officii.
Saint-Gall, Stiftsbiblithek Mss 390 and 391. The Antiphoner of Hartker. Source H of R.-J. Hesbert, Corpus Antiphonalium Officii.
London, British Library Ms Add. 30850. The Antiphoner of Silos. Source S of R.-J. Hesbert, Corpus Antiphonalium Officii.
Zurich, Zentralbibliothek Ms s.n., formerly Rheinau, Abbey Library Ms 28. The Rheinau Antiphoner. Source R of R.-J. Hesbert, Corpus Antiphonalium Officii.
Paris, Bibl. nat. Ms lat. 17296. The Antiphoner of Saint-Denis. Source D of R.-J. Hesbert, Corpus Antiphonalium Officii.
Paris, Bibl. nat. Ms lat. 12584. The Antiphoner of Saint-Maur-les-Fosses. Source F of R.-J. Hesbert, Corpus Antiphonalium Officii.
Benevento, Bibl. Cap. Ms V. 21. The Antiphoner of St Lupus of Benevento. Source L of R.-J. Hesbert, Corpus Antiphonalium Officii.
Paris, Bibl. nat. Ms lat. 17436. The Compiegne Antiphoner. Source C of R.-J. Hesbert, Corpus Antiphonalium Officii.
